title: New River Gorge National River: People
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People               People              The story of New River Gorge is the combined stories of the many people who lived and died here. Each left something behind that contributes to the rich cultural history of this unique place.         Mother Jones The "Miner's Angel" who spent much of her life fighting for the fair treatment of coal miners. more...         Joseph Beury Colonel Joseph Beury established the town of Quinnimont and was the operator of the first coal mine in the New River Gorge. more...         Mary Draper Ingles The story of Mary Draper Ingles' capture by the Shawnees and subsequent journey to freedom along the New River is one of the great stories of survival and endurance. more...         Carter G. Woodson Carter G Woodson, the "Father of Black History," began his career, and gained inspiration for his pioneering work, in the New River Gorge coalfields. more...         John Nuttall John Nuttall founded the coal town of Nuttallburg, one of almost 50 coal towns in New River Gorge, and today one of the most complete coal related sites in the country. more...
